etymology.description: semantic component 网(网) (wǎng, 'net') + phonetic component (unlisted) = related to nets or weaving
etymology.interpretation: This character relates to nets or weaving due to its semantic component 网(网) (wǎng, 'net'). However, it is rare and often supplanted by simpler forms.

examples.chinese: 渔民用𦉎捕鱼(漁民用𦉎捕魚)。
examples.english: The fisherman uses a net to catch fish.

examples.chinese: 他编了一个新的𦉎(他編了一個新的𦉎)，用来捕捉小鱼(用來捕捉小魚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā biān le yīgè xīn de wǎng, yòng lái bǔzhuō xiǎoyú.
examples.english: He wove a new net for catching small fish.
